basics.name: Zachary Guthrie
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a software engineer, passionate problem solver, and empathic human being. I have been a consultant for 5+ years with a wide breadth of experience across many different tech stacks, incorporating aspects outside of code such as Cloud technologies, DevOps, and GenAI. I have a proven track record of excellent product delivery in both individual and team settings, and as both a contributor and team leader. I take pride in my work and love collaborating with other like-minded people, both technical and non-technical.

work.name: Georgia Tech Research Institute
work.summary:
First semester: Created a comprehensive suite of 80+ automated Selenium WebDriver tests for a large-scale AngularJS web application.

Second semester: Mentored testing co-ops in test writing procedures, ensuring to emphasize test coverage as a priority. Created a comprehensive set of manual test procedures to analyze a new patch for a large-scale AngularJS web application.

Third semester: Created multiple components for a large-scale AngularJS web application, adjusting all components of the development stack as necessary. Adjusted complicated SQL queries to fix unintended information retrieval from a database. Converted multiple factories/directives to components. Utilized previous knowledge on thorough testing practices to create and generate appropriate jQuery/Groovy tests for new features in application.

work.name: Georgia Tech Research Institute
work.summary: Created various challenges for Social Media Reconnaissance Challenge. Assured quality of challenges through test work on challenges generated by peers.
